casebody.data:
STATE EX REL. UTILITIES COMMISSION
v.
ATTORNEY GENERAL 271A18-1 Supreme Court of North Carolina. November 15, 2018 Margaret A. Force, Assistant Attorney General, Matthew W. Sawchak, Solicitor General, Jennifer T. Harrod, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, Teresa L. Townsend, Assistant Attorney General, James W. Doggett, Deputy Solicitor General, for Stein, Josh (Attorney General). Kiran H. Mehta, Attorney at Law, Charlotte, Christopher G. Browning, Jr., Attorney at Law, Raleigh, Molly Leigh McIntosh, Attorney at Law, for Duke Energy Progress, LLC. Matthew D. Quinn, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, for Sierra Club. David T. Drooz, Staff Attorney, Lucy E. Edmondson, Staff Attorney, Raleigh, for Public Staff - N.C. Utilities Commission. James P. West, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, for Fayetteville Public Works Commission. Kyle J. Smith, Attorney at Law, for Department of Defense/Federal Executive Agencies.

*85The following order has been entered on the Joint Motion for Extension of Time to File Briefs filed on the 15th of November 2018 by Appellants:

"Motion Allowed by order of the Court in conference, this the 15th of November 2018."

Appellants shall have up to and including the 10th day of December 2018 to file and serve his/her briefs with this Court.
